question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be less than or equal to 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is ≤46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the likelihood of Kamala Harris's victory rise according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Joe Biden publicly announces, before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be clear, unequivocal, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, ensuring that there is no chance of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

In light of this, will Kamala Harris's probability of winning in the Electoral College, as per Nate Silver's model, exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The answer is YES if it is greater than 46.6% at that specified time, and NO otherwise.

This evaluation examines how Biden's choice affects Harris's perceived chances in the model, as monitored on Nate Silver's platform.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to happen: (a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will the likelihood of Kamala winning rise in the coming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would take the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as No.

(b) Will Kamala's chances of winning improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This will resolve to YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve to NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has officially been barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the barring or exclusion must come from official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the indicated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially barred or excluded from a ballot but later reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from participating in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, can he still secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal records, or reliable news sources, and must not be overturned by that date.

Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The conclusion is based on the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final result of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. It is important to note that this question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It specifically relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the individual receiving the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; what matters is who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. being the Republican nominee, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, then the question resolves as **No** for Asa Hutchinson, as only one candidate can be the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Donald Trump Jr. must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, which is impossible if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee. Therefore, if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee, this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. being the Republican nominee, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, then the question resolves as **Yes** for Asa Hutchinson, as he could possibly be a nominee if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Donald Trump Jr. must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, which can happen if Donald Trump Jr. is not the nominee. Therefore, if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee, this resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump Jr. is the chosen Republican candidate, will Asa Hutchinson also be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this scenario occurs, then the answer will be **No** for Asa Hutchinson, since only one individual can hold the nomination.

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Donald Trump Jr. must be selected by the Republican National Convention delegates as the nominee.
Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, which cannot happen if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee. Hence, if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee, this will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other combinations of candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump Jr. nor Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Donald Trump Jr. nor Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other combinations of candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Are Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson both going to be the nominees for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are chosen by the Republican National Convention as candidates for the 2024 Presidential Election. Any other combination of nominees will result in a **No** answer. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 election; the outcome is solely based on the selections made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will he still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, with an official declaration of his death issued before the markets close on Friday, July 26th. 

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to market closure on Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves to NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

If the condition is not satisfied, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET).

Resolves NO if either Joe Biden does not die before the specified time or he does not remain President through the specified time. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution regarding his presidency.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or will he not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET).

Resolves NO if both Joe Biden dies before the specified time and he remains President through the specified time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday and still hold the office of President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden continues to serve as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET).

Resolves NO if either Joe Biden does not pass away before the specified deadline or he does not continue as President during that timeframe. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the resolution concerning his presidency.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly refers to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, by July 15, 2024. This does not consider legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not met.

2. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this condition is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

This means that he is either still on the ballot or has not been confirmed as removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump is on any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is met.

The resolution of this condition is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

The question will resolve as "No" if both of these conditions are met.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Given the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals, will they top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will the USA be the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves positively if the USA is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order.

not_P.title: Given the USA does not win more Gold than Silver medals, will they not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will the USA not be the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the USA does not win more Gold than Silver medals.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves positively if the USA is not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves negatively if no team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order.

para_P.title: If the USA secures a greater number of Gold than Silver medals, will they lead the Olympic Medal Table in Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The United States Olympic Team obtains more Gold medals compared to Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics. Will the USA be the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Criteria for assessing the condition: Resolves to YES if the USA achieves more Gold than Silver medals.
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves positively if the USA is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics occur after 2027. Resolves negatively if any other team has an equal or superior ranking to the US team. Rankings are based on the total number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals, in that order.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals and also top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

not_P.title: Will the USA win not more Gold than Silver medals or not top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves positively if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

para_P.title: Will the USA achieve a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals and also lead the Olympic Medal Table during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) The United States Olympic Team secures more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) highest team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is based on the quantity of Gold medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027, the question will have an unclear resolution. It will be answered negatively if either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to quickly nominate Biden (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are putting together a strategy to publicly oppose their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the ongoing critical discussions regarding his candidacy, as stated by a legislator involved in this movement.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman expressed in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will be considered YES if a public letter opposing the expedited nomination plan is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with an aggregate of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will be deemed NO.

(b) Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is confirmed that 10 or more Democratic Senators exist, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a collective of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters would call on Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals acquainted with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. If five individuals individually inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, will he announce not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If a minimum of five Democratic legislators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, will he declare that he will not accept the nomination prior to July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two lawmakers from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have conveyed to local news sources that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of them would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified members of the Democratic Party from the US House or US Senate collectively ask Joe Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might also occur through a group conversation with Biden where they collectively request him to step down.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. Five individuals individually expressing to journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a reasonable degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Criteria for determining the outcome:

This question will be resolved as YES if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a YES resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

This combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described above.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could mean that no group of five individuals makes a public request to Biden. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. If these criteria are met, this condition resolves YES.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is made prior to the deadline, this condition resolves YES.

This combined question resolves YES if neither (a) nor (b) occur as described above.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition consisting of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Members or Senators must collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be achieved through signing a letter or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden face-to-face. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. If these conditions are not satisfied, this aspect resolves to NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign is required to issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the specified deadline, this aspect resolves to NO.

This combined inquiry resolves to YES if both (a) and (b) take place as outlined above.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for specific groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web platform (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the service name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's offering remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).
