question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.
(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this part, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.
(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this part, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will resolve to yes if Biden withdraws or cannot continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If he does not, it will resolve to no.
(b) This section will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates that may emerge later; the current list is not exhaustive.

For this portion, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it is strictly based on who is nominated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question does not limit itself to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it is not pertinent who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Assuming Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak not succeed in being elected during the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s assume that the following statement holds true: Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Under these circumstances, will Rishi Sunak not achieve election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is indeed chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other outcomes will resolve as **No**.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves to **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during this election, the question will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference credible news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. 

For condition (1), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (2), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this condition will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. 

For condition (1), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (2), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this condition will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. 

For criterion (1), it is irrelevant who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). 

For criterion (2), the question will resolve as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not win a seat as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this criterion will resolve as **No**. Resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden continues as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump not be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Should Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024, will Trump face disqualification from any state ballot due to the 14th Amendment Section 3?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that time. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th Amendment, which appoints his Vice President as Acting President, does not alter this situation.

Is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This is answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. The answer is "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This inquiry specifically relates to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes after this date. If Trump is disqualified or prevented and then later reinstated such that he is not disqualified or prevented as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024, or will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

At least one of the conditions must be met for this question to resolve as "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office at the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump face removal or prohibition from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This will be marked as "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a "Yes" outcome. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution).

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the criteria set forth in Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be validated through formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial declarations will not be adequate for resolution. This question will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria by July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

Both criteria must be fulfilled for this question to be answered "Yes".

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to release a public report detailing findings from an external red-team assessment of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if OpenAI releases a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes the findings from an *external* entity conducting a red-team evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will Anthropic do the same?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI publishes a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Anthropic also publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date?

Resolution criteria for OpenAI: Resolves YES if OpenAI publishes such a report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Anthropic: Resolves YES if Anthropic publishes such a report by June 30, 2024.

not_P.title: Given OpenAI does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will Anthropic not do the same?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI does not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Anthropic also not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date?

Resolution criteria for OpenAI: Resolves YES if OpenAI does not publish such a report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Anthropic: Resolves YES if Anthropic does not publish such a report by June 30, 2024.

para_P.title: If OpenAI releases a report detailing findings from an outside group assessing the safety of their models by June 30, 2024, will Anthropic follow suit?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: OpenAI issues a *public* report containing findings from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Will Anthropic likewise release a *public* report featuring results from an *external* group assessing the safety of one of their AI models by the same deadline?

Criteria for OpenAI's resolution: Resolves YES if OpenAI releases such a report by June 30, 2024.
Criteria for Anthropic's resolution: Resolves YES if Anthropic releases such a report by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will both OpenAI and Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, both OpenAI and Anthropic publish *public* reports with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of their AI models. Specifically: (a) OpenAI publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will neither OpenAI nor Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, neither OpenAI nor Anthropic publish *public* reports with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of their AI models. Specifically: (a) OpenAI does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI and Anthropic both release public reports detailing the outcomes of external assessments of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI and Anthropic each make available *public* reports that present the findings from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of their AI models. Specifically: (a) OpenAI must issue a public report containing the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic must issue a public report containing the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Will there be a declaration of new tariffs or duties by the European Union on imports of electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will at least 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will fewer than 5 Dem House Members or Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- Fewer than five named Democratic House Members or Senators must not collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the EU imposes new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will a minimum of five Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible connection between two political occurrences. Assume the following holds true: Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has instituted new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this context, is it accurate that a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators will collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate exiting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to be resolved as YES:
- The EU must implement new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- A minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must jointly apply pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a collective action, such as signing a letter or making a unified in-person appeal.

If either of these stipulations is not satisfied, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, nor (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. If five individuals separately tell reporters they think Biden should drop out, that would be sufficient for a NO resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) the EU will declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (2) at least five specified Democratic House Members or US Senators will exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be deemed **Yes** if, by July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has proclaimed new tariffs or duties that will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will be considered **Yes** if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to reflect on halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be executed by signing a letter, as reported, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals separately informing reporters that they believe Biden should step aside is inadequate for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to resign will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve using the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is obtained. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate as a figure out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as indicated by the blue trend line on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is based on the data available for July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as July 20 data is available, or by July 22 if July 19 data is missing.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris confirms either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP pick, and NO if she confirms anyone else.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome is based on Kamala Harris' announcement.

not_P.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick not be Kelly or Shapiro?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as indicated by the blue trend line on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is based on the data available for July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as July 20 data is available, or by July 22 if July 19 data is missing.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris confirms anyone else as her VP pick, and NO if she confirms either Kelly or Shapiro.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome is based on Kamala Harris' announcement.

para_P.title: If FiveThirtyEight shows Biden as leading on Friday, will Kamala Harris select Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight forecasts Joe Biden as having a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, as depicted by the blue trend line in the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This conclusion is drawn from the data available on July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as data from July 20 is accessible, or by July 22 if data from July 19 is absent.

Then, is it accurate that Kamala Harris will declare her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th, 2024? This will be resolved as YES if Kamala Harris endorses either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP selection, and NO if she endorses someone else.

The criteria for resolution are grounded in FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome relies on Kamala Harris' announcement.

question.title: Will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and will Kamala Harris choose Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP pick?
question.body: This question resolves to 'Yes' if both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, as per the blue and red trend lines on https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; and (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7, 2024, confirmed by Kamala herself. The resolution of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will wait for the July 20 datapoints to become available, and if unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The VP pick resolves when confirmed by Kamala Harris.

not_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or will Kamala Harris choose a VP pick that is neither Mark Kelly nor Josh Shapiro?
not_P.body: This question resolves to 'Yes' if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, as per the blue and red trend lines on https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; or (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7, 2024, confirmed by Kamala herself. The resolution of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will wait for the July 20 datapoints to become available, and if unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The VP pick resolves when confirmed by Kamala Harris.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner, and will Kamala Harris select either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro for her vice-presidential candidate?
para_P.body: This question will be considered 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are met: (a) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden must have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, as shown by the blue and red trend lines found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; and (b) Kamala Harris must publicly announce her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7, 2024, with confirmation from Kamala herself. The resolution of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will depend on the data points available on July 20, and if those are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19. The selection of the VP will be confirmed once Kamala Harris makes her announcement.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Liz Cheney is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election? This resolves as Yes if there are no credible sources reporting that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not based on who is nominated on the election day.

Then, can we say that the Republican Party will maintain its hold on Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024? This will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an authoritative statement or source from Ohio will be considered. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this inquiry will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party will not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has not won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will be answered with Yes if reliable sources indicate that a Republican candidate has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or statement will be prioritized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will no Trump family member be the Republican nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that no member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This resolves **Yes** if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will a Trump family member be the candidate for the Republican Party?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Before midnight Eastern time on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. This announcement must be clear and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

In that case, is it correct to say that a Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024? This is considered **Yes** if one of the following individuals becomes the Republican nominee:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. (2) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President OR will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if EITHER of the following conditions are met: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. (2) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If either condition is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will a Trump family member be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if BOTH of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. (2) One of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If both criteria are not satisfied, this inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is measured as a positive value between 2 and 3, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the national polling average reported by 538 for July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024.

Then, is the following true? Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no possibility for Biden accepting the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the specified time, the outcome resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is measured as a positive value between 2 and 3, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the national polling average reported by 538 for July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024.

Then, is the following true? Will Joe Biden or his campaign not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no possibility for Biden not accepting the nomination. If such an announcement is made by the specified time, the outcome resolves as Yes.
