question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be named president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will result in a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into consideration.

Resolver

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he remains President, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he does not remain President, and NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, will Biden still hold the office of President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This conclusion will rely on official announcements from the US government or a general agreement of trustworthy news sources.

Then, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden continues to be the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves to YES if he continues in the role of President, and NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. It is important to note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not lead to a YES resolution, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; nor (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Is it possible that (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden continues to be the US President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially acknowledged as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources; and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as US President until the end of July 2024 (ET), without resigning, passing away, or otherwise ending his presidency before that date. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this situation, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate? The resolution is YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the resolution is NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this situation, will Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate? The resolution is YES if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is selected as VP, the resolution is NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden declines the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic nominee for Vice President?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will neither pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. This announcement must be explicit and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

In light of this scenario, will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic candidate for Vice President? The answer is YES if Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP. If another individual is chosen for VP, the answer is NO. Subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not influence the answer.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or will Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

If both of these conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and final, leaving no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination. (2) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is appointed as VP, this market will resolve to no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if, at around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap and verified by Metaculus.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: 
- This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.
- If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: 
- This resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by not signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as not having a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- All individuals must be part of the same group message. If fewer than five people separately tell reporters they think Biden should drop out, that is sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats not writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.
- If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, with Nvidia's market cap exceeding that of Apple, will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple as per Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Will a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Criteria for resolution regarding this scenario: 
- This will be considered YES if a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be through signing a letter, or it could manifest in another manner such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.
- All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently informing reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is not adequate for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before the market's conclusion. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not verified beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.
- If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's, and will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following occur: (1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's, or will fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) Fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. Not all five individuals must be part of the same group message.

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024, and will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators advocate for Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: (1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 presidential campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or engaging in another method, such as a group discussion with Biden in person, collectively urging him to withdraw. All five members must participate in the same collective communication.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Larry Elder be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- For Kamala Harris: Resolves YES if she is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected, resolves NO. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.
- For Larry Elder: Resolves YES if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as NO. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee, will Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Larry Elder not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- For Kamala Harris: Resolves YES if she is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected, resolves NO. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.
- For Larry Elder: Resolves YES if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as NO. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, will Larry Elder be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. Will Larry Elder be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- Regarding Kamala Harris: Resolves YES if she is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is nominated, resolves NO. Subsequent changes after the initial nomination do not impact the resolution.
- Concerning Larry Elder: Resolves YES if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates are resolved as NO. The resolution is determined solely by the selection made by the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee and (2) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is determined at the time of the initial nomination and is not affected by any changes thereafter.

(2) Larry Elder: This condition is met if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it is determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

not_P.body:

(2) Larry Elder: This condition is met if Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it is determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) Kamala Harris to be chosen as the Democratic VP candidate and (2) Larry Elder to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: The first condition is satisfied if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. If a different individual is appointed as VP, then this condition is not fulfilled. The selection of the VP candidate is finalized at the time of the primary nomination and remains unchanged thereafter.

(2) Larry Elder: The second condition is satisfied if Larry Elder is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the nominee on election day is irrelevant; what matters is the decision made by the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are currently available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the wider public opinion?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

The condition is met if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more, calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

not_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is less than that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < -0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. Will USD be worth < 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Will Trump receive at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, given that he is up against Joe Biden? (b) Will the value of USD be at least 145 JPY (yen) at the closing on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll presents Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other features a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. This market will be deemed YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or greater upon their closure. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is at least 0.03. If not, it is NO.

(b) The market will conclude based on the USD/JPY closing value recorded for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. Will the USD be valued at 145 JPY (yen) or more at the close on August 9th, 2024?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick not be Kelly or Shapiro?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Kamala Harris select Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential choice?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario occurs: Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. In that case, will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: The condition is fulfilled if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris declares her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves to NO if Kamala Harris announces a different individual as her running mate. The selection must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as VP before August 7?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. The market resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 nor (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as VP before August 7?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. The market resolves YES if neither (a) nor (b) occurs as described. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate before August 7?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the election before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (b) Kamala Harris makes an announcement regarding her choice for running mate, selecting either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, before August 7, with confirmation from Kamala herself. The outcome will be YES if both (a) and (b) happen as specified. Otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs involving prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Given there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris become president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used.

not_P.title: Given there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris not become president by Friday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, will Kamala Harris not be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used.

para_P.title: If another Democratic party presidential debate occurs, will Kamala Harris be appointed president by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: A debate is held among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, will Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of credible reporting.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention nor (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is never formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party occurs prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (for instance, Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.
(b) This market will be marked as "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, this market will be marked as "No". The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is it true that Chris Christie is also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: 
- Glenn Youngkin is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Chris Christie is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Note: Only one individual can be the nominee. If Glenn Youngkin is the nominee, Chris Christie cannot also be the nominee, and vice versa.

Assuming the following holds true: The Republican National Convention has chosen Glenn Youngkin as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, can we conclude that Chris Christie is likewise chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for resolution: 
- Glenn Youngkin is considered the nominee if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Chris Christie is regarded as the nominee if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Important note: Only one person can hold the position of nominee. If Glenn Youngkin is the nominee, then Chris Christie cannot be the nominee, and the same applies in reverse.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other combinations of candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This includes any combination where at least one of them is not selected, or if neither is selected.
