para_P.title: Are Lithuania and Azerbaijan both going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Lithuania or Azerbaijan fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question considers the condition where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by 538 and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. 

Given this condition, the question then asks whether Vivek Ramaswamy will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

not_P.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question considers the condition where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by 538 and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. 

Given this condition, the question then asks whether Vivek Ramaswamy will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

para_P.title: Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, is it true that Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the scenario where Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, specifically when that lead is more than 3 points but not exceeding 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's data as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. 

In light of this scenario, the question seeks to determine if Vivek Ramaswamy will be chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. The outcome will depend on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who ultimately secures the nomination on election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceed 3 but be at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the 538 national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will be marked as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Portugal not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Portugal makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland make it as well?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Poland also advance to the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not advance, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland does not qualify, or if neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Portugal or Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Portugal and Poland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Portugal and Poland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland fails to qualify, or if neither qualifies, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, if Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is met. Resolves NO if Biden drops out but the condition is not met. Resolves N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, if Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is not met. Resolves NO if Biden drops out but the condition is met. Resolves N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming there is an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party, if Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report on the situation at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: There will be a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. In this context, if President Joe Biden chooses to withdraw, will a major and trustworthy news outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provide coverage of his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to Biden making his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc.? 

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Resolves YES if the debate occurs as described. Resolves NO otherwise. 
Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is satisfied. Resolves NO if Biden withdraws but the condition is not satisfied. Resolves N/A if Biden remains in the race until the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate takes place (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate takes place (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet does not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout without an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it certain that both of the following will happen: (a) A subsequent presidential debate for the Democratic party occurs (b) Should Joe Biden withdraw, a reputable news organization reports the news at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO in other cases.

(b) This question will be marked as YES if a major and trustworthy news source like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially declares his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) going to establish a political coalition with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an electoral coalition or alliance agreement is officially declared between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) prior to June 30, 2024, for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not announced, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given the Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election. This means that before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given the Republicans Party of France does not form an alliance with the National Rally, will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) does not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election. This means that before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is not officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If such an agreement is announced, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the Prime Minister of France will belong to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the Republicans Party of France enters into a partnership with the National Rally, will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) establishes a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections. This indicates that prior to June 30, 2024, an official electoral partnership or coalition agreement is declared between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative elections, based on reliable sources. If such an agreement is not declared, this condition is not satisfied.

Then, can it be confirmed that the Prime Minister of France will be affiliated with a coalition that is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This is determined as Yes if the Prime Minister's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30 at 12:00 Central European Time, according to trustworthy sources. If the condition is not fulfilled, the question is deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister's party is New Popular Front or Together, this component resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition that is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following are true: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If such an agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together, this component resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) establishes a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official announcement of an electoral partnership or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, as reported by reliable sources. If such an agreement is not announced, this part will resolve as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party representing the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together, based on credible sources. If the Prime Minister's party is New Popular Front or Together, this part will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Suppose Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Conditional on this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Suppose Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Conditional on this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and Joe Biden withdraws from the race, will a trustworthy news organization report the incident at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve to **Yes** if, after the publication date of this inquiry and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack attributed to Israel that has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

Assuming this condition is met, if President Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a major and reputable news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provide coverage of his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes his official announcement through a letter, speech, or similar means.

Reports from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw prior to the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, nor (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Therefore, this negation will resolve YES if such credible reports do not indicate that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's borders leading to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Therefore, this negation will resolve YES if such a media outlet does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours in advance. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Israel executes a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a trustworthy news source reports on the situation at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

(b) This question will be answered YES if a major and reputable media organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden formally announces his departure through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Imagine Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In that case, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for the condition to be met: This is considered Yes if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a No.

Criteria for the outcome: This is considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this will resolve as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

(b) This question will resolve as No if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a No resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as Yes.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This question is open to other candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is made solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report issues.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump runs against Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls end.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The answer will be YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: If Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above condition is met: Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?

This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: If Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will he not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above condition is not met: Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?

This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Should Trump testify at the hush money trial if he receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, specifically against Biden?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold respondents to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas every other Democrat included in hypothetical scenarios appears to be polling ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold respondents reflect the views of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation to find the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The response is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

Assuming the above condition is satisfied: Trump achieves at least a 3% advantage among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?

This question will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? (b) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul
@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if no credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to the figure for June 2024.

The data for this determination will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden NOT be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value. Then, will Biden NOT be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do NOT invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure. Consequently, will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024? This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for (b): GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for (b): GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) The US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024 (b) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context for (b): A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws before July 20, will Trump face removal or exclusion from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will face removal or exclusion from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or exclusion must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documentation, or credible media sources. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024. It strictly relates to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or reversals after this date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: (a) This condition will be met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) This condition will not be met if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race after July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will not be met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is either excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This requirement will be fulfilled if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing in the race prior to July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) This requirement will be fulfilled if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The exclusion or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. The question will be answered as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later changes that might happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him being on the ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland also qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Poland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Ireland achieve qualification as well?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Ireland also manage to qualify for the Grand Final? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Poland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
