If either Poland or Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Will there be an officially sanctioned referendum in Scotland regarding independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to carry any legal authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to allow the vote, nor by a referendum organized by civil society groups. The referendum must have the approval of the London government.

question.title: Given Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions into a conditional one. 

Condition: Scotland must hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be advisory but must not be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum without UK government consent.

Outcome: Resolves YES if the linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

This inquiry merges two distinct forecasting questions into a conditional format. 

Condition: Scotland is required to conduct a legitimate, authorized referendum on its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can serve as an advisory but must not resemble a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum lacking UK government approval.

Outcome: Resolves to YES if the associated market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has garnered at least 377 traders before it concludes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.body:
(a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024. This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. (b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023. Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, nor (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023?

This includes cases where the referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, or by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must not be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) The linked market does not get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023. Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; thus, it does not need to carry any legally binding consequences. It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society organizations. A referendum must be regarded as having the approval of the London government.

(b) The associated market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2023. question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement confirming that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 electoral cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories indicating Russian control?

The resolution criteria for the outcome are as follows: The question resolves as YES if the location is assessed to be under Russian control as per the ISW map categories. It resolves as NO if the location is not under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of non-acceptance.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories indicating Russian control?

The resolution criteria for the outcome are as follows: The question resolves as YES if the location is not assessed to be under Russian control as per the ISW map categories. It resolves as NO if the location is assessed to be under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public declaration that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for acceptance.

Then, is it the case that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any classification that suggests Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other similar classifications indicating Russian control?

The criteria for determining the outcome are as follows: The question is answered with YES if the location is evaluated to be under Russian control according to the ISW map classifications. It is answered with NO if the location is not under Russian control, as indicated by categories like Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any other similar classifications indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, nor (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following two events will take place: (a) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Russia will have seized control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not classified in any of the categories that suggest Russian control, including but not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW indicating Ukrainian control of the area or the absence of Russian control.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report the development at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Note that local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Inflection not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will Inflection release a report detailing the outcomes of external assessments of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this inquiry will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *independent* party evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Inflection publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: For Inflection, this resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for this question: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain demographics, this will still resolve positively if at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same.

not_P.title: Conditional on Inflection not publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Inflection does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: For Inflection, this resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for this question: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If available in certain EU countries, or available to certain demographics, this will still resolve positively if at least ≤50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is not substantially the same.

para_P.title: If Inflection releases a report detailing the outcomes of external red-teaming of their safety models by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Inflection makes public a report containing findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Criteria for resolving this condition: For Inflection, this is considered YES if, by June 30, 2024, they release a public report with the results from an external analysis of the safety of one of their AI models.

In light of this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for resolving this inquiry: The question is answered with YES if ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations or for specific demographics, it will still be considered positive if more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and is regarded as positive if the service is largely unchanged.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing the findings from an external assessment of their models' safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this inquiry will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they make a *publicly available* report that includes the findings from an *independent* examination of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without employing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or restricted for certain groups (like minors), the question will still resolve positively as long as more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or URL changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by any other candidates or options.

Given this, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The resolution will be based on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If Biden is projected as the favorite, the answer is YES. If Trump is projected as the favorite, the answer is NO. If both have equal odds, the resolution is 50-50. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic box office opening exceeds the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than the combined domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391 in total, as reported by Boxofficemojo.

Given this condition, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: "Deadpool & Wolverine" must have a domestic box office opening higher than $185,548,391.
- For the outcome: "Trap" must receive a B CinemaScore or higher to resolve YES, and a B- or lower to resolve NO. If no CinemaScore is reported, it resolves N/A.

Context:
- "Trap" is directed by M. Night Shyamalan, known for films like "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Serbia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Serbia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Serbia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Malta secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Serbia also make it through?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Malta competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Serbia also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Criteria for determining Serbia's qualification: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Serbia participate in a Semi-final or are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Serbia both set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Malta and Serbia take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:

Condition: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

If the condition regarding the BSE SENSEX is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Donald Trump holds an advantage over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This is ascertained from the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in front.

Then, can we confirm that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will register a higher Year-over-Year value on July 20, 2024? This will be determined by data from the St. Louis Fed. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates presently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 election; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this situation, will President Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will not meet the condition.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question examines the scenario where Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this situation, will President Biden not drop out and be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will not meet the condition.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry explores the situation in which Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, will President Biden withdraw or be incapable of proceeding with his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time?

Criteria for determining the condition: Tucker Carlson must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection of any other candidate will not satisfy the condition.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

Details:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.
(b) Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If either condition is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

Details:
(a) Tucker Carlson must not be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.
(b) Biden must not drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden withdraws before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to participate in the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If either condition fails to be fulfilled, this inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

Details:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant.
(b) Biden must withdraw or be unable to continue the race prior to July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Given Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine, will its domestic box office opening be higher than Deadpool and The Wolverine combined?

Then, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013)?

Resolution criteria: This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body:
Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the following is true: The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15. Then, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

para_P.title: If the associated market reaches a minimum of 377 participants by the conclusion of July 15, will ISS recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body:
Apologies to my very dedicated followers, I’ve found myself caught up in some market activities, hence I’m creating this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) This will resolve to YES if the market linked above attracts 377 participants prior to the market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO in all other cases.

The inquiry will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder assembly OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

Assuming the following holds: The associated market garners at least 377 participants by the end of July 15. Will ISS then urge Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, and (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the following link has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time): https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) The question resolves YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, or (b) ISS does not advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body:
