(b) The question resolves YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND does not advise against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The linked market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, and (b) ISS recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the market referenced in the following link has gathered 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time): https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g. It will be NO otherwise.

(b) The question will be YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to reject Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the question will be NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs before this deadline. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement does not occur before this deadline. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will he pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his role" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

In light of this, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th? The answer is YES if such a declaration is made before this cutoff. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden does not die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated according to the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to enforce the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: If Nvidia's market cap exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it true that Donald Trump will have been removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Nvidia's market cap must be greater than Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: If Nvidia's market cap does not exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump not be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not have been removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Nvidia's market cap must not be greater than Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must not have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump be disqualified from any primary ballot in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is confirmed to be greater than Apple's, as reported by Companies Market Cap and validated by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will have been disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: Nvidia's market cap must exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Donald Trump must have been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be substantiated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate. The resolution does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that occur after July 15, 2024.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions is not met. Note: For the second condition, the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's or will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of these conditions is met. Note: For the second condition, the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: By July 17, 2024, will Nvidia surpass Apple in market capitalization, and will Donald Trump be prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to Yes if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) As of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will be answered "No" if either of these conditions is not fulfilled. Note: For the second criterion, the question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after July 15, 2024. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position on the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or removed from a ballot but then reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or removed from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, i.e., they have a brokered convention.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is needed, and **No** if only one ballot is required.

Then, is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, i.e., they have a brokered convention.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is needed, and **No** if only one ballot is required.

Then, is it true that fewer than 10 Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, meaning they are having a brokered convention.

Criteria for resolution of the condition: This is determined as **Yes** if multiple rounds of voting are necessary, and **No** if only one ballot suffices.

So, is it accurate to say that at least 10 Democratic Senators will advocate for Biden to step down before July 20?

Criteria for resolution of the outcome: This is determined as **Yes** if, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the evidence indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to resign. Otherwise, it is resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the resolution source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the resolution source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this will be **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20: If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, the resolution source indicates 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to step down, this will resolve as **Yes**. If not, it will resolve as **No**. The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if the total number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Conditional on at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France place in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the number of world records broken and France's performance at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will France place in the top 5 in the medal table?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves positively if France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals, ordered by the number of gold, then silver, then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not take place, the outcome resolves ambiguously.

not_P.title: Conditional on at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between the number of world records broken and France's performance at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will France not place in the top 5 in the medal table?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves positively if France does not place in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals, ordered by the number of gold, then silver, then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not take place, the outcome resolves ambiguously.

para_P.title: Given that a minimum of 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, will France achieve a Top 5 finish?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the quantity of world records established and France's results at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Assuming the following holds true: A minimum of 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will France secure a position within the top 5 of the medal standings?

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: The condition is fulfilled if 24 or more world records are established at the Paris Olympics.

Criteria for the outcome: The outcome is deemed positive if France ranks in the top 5 of the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by the overall count of medals, prioritized by gold, followed by silver, and then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not occur, the outcome is considered uncertain.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by ordering the total number of medals won by each participating country by: (a) Number of Gold Medals, (b) Number of Silver Medals (in case of a tie in Gold), and (c) Number of Bronze Medals (in case of a tie in Silver). The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken (b) France places in the Top 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by ordering the total number of medals won by each participating country by: (a) Number of Gold Medals, (b) Number of Silver Medals (in case of a tie in Gold), and (c) Number of Bronze Medals (in case of a tie in Silver). The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records are set (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) At least 24 world records are established. (2) France secures a position in the top 5 of the medal standings, which is determined by ranking the total number of medals earned by each participating nation based on: (a) Count of Gold Medals, (b) Count of Silver Medals (if there is a tie in Gold), and (c) Count of Bronze Medals (if there is a tie in Silver). The question will be deemed ambiguous if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if such termination occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination, will the US government not end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if such termination does not occur before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden publicly declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the United States government cancel its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to change his mind regarding the nomination.

In that case, will the US Department of Commerce formally end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if such termination occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) The US government will end its agreement allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(2) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (2) The US government will end its agreement allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of not accepting the nomination. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as Yes.

(2) Will the US government continue its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, after August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. If this happens, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden will declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) The US government will terminate its agreement permitting Verisign to oversee the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party’s nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility of accepting the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

(2) Will the US government conclude its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if the US Department of Commerce officially cancels or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, this will be considered No.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be considered a Yes if Team USA claims both gold medals. It will be a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Then, given this, will the Philadelphia 76ers be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No for all other outcomes.

not_P.body:

Then, given this, will the Philadelphia 76ers not be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No for all other outcomes.

para_P.title: Assuming the United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: The United States achieves gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics. 

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: It is considered a Yes if Team USA claims both gold medals. It is a No if either the men's or women's squad finishes in a position other than first. 

In light of this, will the Philadelphia 76ers be recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA? 

Criteria for the outcome: It is a Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are acknowledged as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It is a No for any other results.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

(b) The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Team USA does not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves Yes if Team USA fails to win at least one gold medal in Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves no if both teams win gold medals.

(b) The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned champions.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to happen: (a) Team USA secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers become the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
(a) This part resolves to Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. It resolves to No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first.

(b) This question resolves to **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, as determined by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves to **No** for any other teams that do not win.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

2. Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Norway fails to qualify, this question resolves as N/A. If Norway qualifies but Switzerland does not, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both Norway and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Norway nor Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Norway and Switzerland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland take part in their respective Semi-finals and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if either Norway or Switzerland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories created by ISW.

Then, is the following also true on July 15, 2024: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This would be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: GIVEN Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question will resolve as true if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement going to receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Then, will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has not accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's lack of commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as NO. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Pandemic Agreement is approved during a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), based on information from reliable sources. 

In that case, will OpenAI publicly endorse the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if OpenAI, before July 1, 2024, makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must reflect a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot merely repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism." Furthermore, Metaculus needs to confirm that at least one member of righttowarn.ai is satisfied with the company's acceptance of the principle. Metaculus may contact certain signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as robust as "this was a good initial step" for the question to conclude as YES. If the condition is not fulfilled, it resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly and (b) OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly nor (b) OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following are true:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of dissatisfaction with OpenAI's commitment.
