para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024 and (b) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. At the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, the Pandemic Agreement is ratified through a vote, as reported by reliable sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly affirms its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment made during an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must reflect a new commitment level to the principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was made; it cannot merely repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism". Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may consult selected signatories or endorsers to gauge their satisfaction level with OpenAI's commitment. Statements need to be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for the resolution of this question to be **Yes**.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

not_P.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close at $100 or more per share by 7/31?
not_P.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes at $100 or more on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to finish below $100 per share by July 31?
para_P.body: This market will be deemed YES if NVDA ends any day prior to July 31 at a price lower than $100.

question.title: Given Nvidia closes below $100 per share by 7/31, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Given Nvidia closes below $100 per share by 7/31, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: If Nvidia trades below $100 per share prior to 7/31, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) trades below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: The market will determine YES if NVDA trades below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: Resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31 and (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.
(b) This resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31 nor (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if NVDA does not close below $100 on any day before 7/31.
(b) This resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) ends a trading day below $100 per share at any point prior to 7/31 and (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered a YES if NVDA finishes a day below $100 before 7/31.
(b) This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the specific figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported on July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed. Then, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution criterion for the condition is that the reported number for July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. The resolution criterion for the outcome is that Donald Trump is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is not higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is not higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed. Then, will Donald Trump not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution criterion for the condition is that the reported number for July 20, 2024, must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. The resolution criterion for the outcome is that Donald Trump is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: If the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is elevated Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, as indicated by the St. Louis Fed. Then, will Donald Trump be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The condition's resolution criterion is that the figure reported for July 20, 2024, must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023. The outcome's resolution criterion is that Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention delegates as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) The question about Donald Trump will resolve as **Yes** if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) The question about Donald Trump will resolve as **No** if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it will resolve as **Yes**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The determination regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported on July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) The inquiry concerning Donald Trump will be answered as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered as **No**. This question may include new candidates that may be introduced later. The outcome is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the head of the Secret Service step down within the following 90 days?
para_P.body: Assuming the scenario where Joe Biden dies before the conclusion of Friday, July 26th, as publicly stated. In that case, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be terminated, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason continues to serve as the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday, and will the head of the Secret Service step down within the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the U.S. Secret Service Director, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is the nominee.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This resolves based on the reported value on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and we are interested in whether this value is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

not_P.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden not be greater than 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is the nominee.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden not be greater than 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This resolves based on the reported value on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and we are interested in whether this value is not greater than 3 or greater than 4.

para_P.title: Should Ted Cruz become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not go over 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be considered **Yes** if Ted Cruz is indeed the candidate.

Next, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? This will be determined by the value shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which was retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, and we are focusing on whether this figure is greater than 3 and at most 4.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Ted Cruz will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden will not be greater than 3 or will not be greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 or is not less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) The Republican National Convention nominates Ted Cruz as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined by the choice of the delegates at the convention, rather than the announcement made on election day.

(b) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump holds a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 3 but does not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, as seen in the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive announcement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its resolution will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will there be a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate occurs, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination, will there be no other Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would refuse the nomination.

Given this, will there be no debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate does not occur, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a clear announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will there be another debate among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement confirming that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

In light of this, will there be a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate takes place, and NO if it does not.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there is another Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will there not be another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. Resolves as No otherwise.

(2) Will there not be another Democratic party presidential debate?

This resolves as Yes if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if either (1) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President or (2) there is not another Democratic party presidential debate. Resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and will there be an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. It will be No otherwise.

(2) Will there be an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party?

This will be Yes if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No otherwise.

The overall question will be Yes if both (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President and (2) there is an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party. It will be No otherwise.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a public report detailing findings from an external safety evaluation of their models?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* entity that has conducted a red-team assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on that date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

not_P.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind not publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on that date?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if available in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as <=50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves negatively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

para_P.title: If Google DeepMind releases a report detailing the outcomes of external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the EU on that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind makes available a public report with findings from an external party evaluating the safety of one of their AI models. In light of this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for the condition to be considered met: The condition is satisfied if Google DeepMind releases a public report with findings from an external party assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for the outcome to be considered YES: The inquiry is answered affirmatively if ChatGPT is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, indicating that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment. It also resolves positively if it is not available in certain EU nations or to specific groups, as long as more than 50% of the population can use it. 'ChatGPT' refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the name or website changes but the service remains fundamentally the same.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a report from Google DeepMind detailing the findings of external safety evaluations of their models is published, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the results from an *external* evaluation focused on the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) This question will be resolved as **YES** for OpenAI's ChatGPT if it is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

The term "broadly accessible" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they are able to access it without needing a VPN (which may involve a subscription fee). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's offering remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in polling figures between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to count, it must be an in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is not greater than 3 or less than or equal to 2 on July 15, 2024, will Biden not have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 3 or less than or equal to 2 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to count, it must be an in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is YES.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute face-to-face interview before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but is at most 3, according to the national polling average from 538. This is verified by checking the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure signifies a Trump advantage.

Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will participate in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to be considered valid, it must be a face-to-face interview featuring no less than 45 minutes of new footage of him being questioned. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar gatherings do not qualify. However, appearances on podcasts, late-night television, or segments edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is made public by the end of July, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves NO. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves YES. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes, before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another such in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve as NO. 

This market does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court announce arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) releases a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be marked as **No** if this does not occur.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Conditional on the ICC issuing arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as No if the above does not happen.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the ICC issuing arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist attack not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if no terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as No if the above does happen.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario occurs: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for any of these Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. In that case, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for fulfilling the condition: The condition is satisfied if the ICC issues an arrest warrant for any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The incident must be officially classified as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question is answered with No if the above conditions are not met.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question is answered as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The ICC does not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) does not injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be answered with **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be answered with No if this does not occur.

An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French state agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, we then inquire whether credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, whether in person or remotely. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, we then inquire whether credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified at the trial, whether in person or remotely. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this premise, we then seek to determine whether reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony at the trial, whether in person or virtually. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If either of the above conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: 

1. Will Hurd not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. No credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If either of the above conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: 

1. Hurd is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is independent of who is nominated by the Republican party on the date of the 2024 US election.

2. Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, regarding the trial about the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

If either of these conditions is not satisfied, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the conclusion will be **No**.

question.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Slovenia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Slovenia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Malta secures a spot in the Grand Final for Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia make it as well?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Malta competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a position in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia also secure a position in the Grand Final? 

Criteria for resolution regarding Slovenia: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a position in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Malta and Slovenia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Malta and Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.
