para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight forecast for that same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are seen as having equal chances, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes to the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight in calculating its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 times out of 100”). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, meaning he has a higher probability of winning than Trump based on the trend lines for that date.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves to "Yes" if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to "No" if Trump has a higher probability. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

Now, given this condition, consider the outcome: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

not_P.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden not be greater than 2 or not be less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, meaning he has a higher probability of winning than Trump based on the trend lines for that date.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves to "No" if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to "Yes" if Trump has a higher probability. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

Now, given this condition, consider the outcome: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden not be greater than 2 or not be less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves "No" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, if 538 indicates Biden as the frontrunner, will Trump have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: On July 19, 2024, the FiveThirtyEight election forecast shows Joe Biden as the frontrunner against Donald Trump, implying he has a greater chance of winning than Trump according to the trend lines for that date.

Criteria for determining the condition (P): This is considered "Yes" if Biden's winning probability is higher than Trump's according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It is considered "No" if Trump's probability is greater. If their probabilities are equal, it resolves to 50-50.

Given this premise, evaluate the result: Will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome (Q): This is "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and at most 4 points as shown on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will not be greater than 2 or not be less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) 538 will indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. The resolution will be based on the data provided by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically referring to the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest earlier figures to July 19. The resolution will consider the winning odds for each candidate as a percentage out of 100, rounded to one decimal place.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, as presented in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, will be greater than 2 and at most 4, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain in the presidency until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will confirm a yes answer if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Joe Biden's status as president and the opposition within his party to an early nomination plan.

Condition: Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also suffice. Resolves NO if these criteria are not met by market close.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between Joe Biden's status as president and the opposition within his party to an early nomination plan.

Condition: Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden remains in the presidency until the conclusion of July, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between Joe Biden's presidency and the dissent within his party regarding an early nomination initiative.

Condition: Joe Biden must still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party endorse a public letter against the early nomination initiative before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that together have 20 signatures will also be acceptable. Resolves NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also satisfy this condition. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024 or will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. If at least one of these conditions is met, this question resolves to YES.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office as president, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate him early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, 2024, at least 20 members of the House or Senate who are affiliated with the Democratic Party must sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan. The condition will also be satisfied if multiple letters collectively contain signatures from at least 20 lawmakers. If either of these conditions is not satisfied, the answer to this inquiry will be negative.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the question to resolve as Yes. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland not qualify?

Then, will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final? Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the question to resolve as Yes. If Poland qualifies, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Portugal secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland also secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Then, will Poland also secure a place in the Grand Final? Poland must take part in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024 for the answer to be Yes. If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Portugal and Poland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Portugal or Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Portugal or Poland does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Portugal and Poland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Portugal and Poland both going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Portugal and Poland take part in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates that Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if more than one round is needed, indicating a brokered convention, and **No** if only one ballot is required.

not_P.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if only one ballot is required, indicating no brokered convention, and **No** if more than one round is needed.

para_P.title: Given that Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538. This information is derived from the value shown on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a lead for Trump.

Then, will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? The answer will be **Yes** if multiple rounds are necessary, indicating a brokered convention, and **No** if only a single ballot is sufficient.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
(b) Democrats will have a brokered convention if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, this condition is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be 2 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be 2 or less or greater than 4. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
(b) Democrats will not have a brokered convention if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, this condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) on July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538, and (b) the Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The measure of Trump's advantage over Biden will be taken from 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, which must exceed 2 but not go beyond 4. Metaculus will verify this on July 17, 2024.
(b) A brokered convention for the Democrats will take place if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this condition will not be satisfied.

question.title: Will Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Finland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Finland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Finland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Finland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Given Finland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Norway: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Finland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Norway: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Finland makes it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Norway make it as well?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Finland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway also advance to the Grand Final? 

Criteria for determining Norway's qualification: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway fails to qualify, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both Finland and Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Finland and Norway participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Finland or Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Finland nor Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Finland nor Norway participate in their respective Semi-finals or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Finland or Norway does qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Finland and Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Finland and Norway take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Finland or Norway fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether it be in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Iran initiate military action before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying at his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran initiating military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory.

Criterion for condition: Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy force actions do not count.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Iran not initiate military action before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying at his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran not initiating military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory.

Criterion for condition: Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy force actions do not count.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony during the hush money trial, will Iran take military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible link between two apparently unrelated occurrences: Donald Trump giving testimony in his trial related to "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran commencing military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries.

Condition for the scenario: Reliable sources must indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the mentioned trial.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Iran undertakes military actions on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially reported by the Iranian government or through a consensus of credible news sources. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures. Only actions explicitly stated by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Actions by proxy forces are not included.

If the condition is unmet, the question is deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran not initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran launch a military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will be deemed "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, this market will be marked as "No".

For this market's resolution, a "military operation" refers to any act of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility on Israeli soil, this market will resolve to "Yes") and is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible news sources. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:

This means he is the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of other candidates or the final nominee on the day of the election.

Given this scenario, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? This will resolve as Yes if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the specified source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

This will be considered Yes if, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the designated source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are urging Biden to withdraw. If not, it will be considered No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

question.body:

It will resolve as **No** if any other political group holds the most seats, unless there is a tie, in which case both groups are considered to hold the most seats.

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this scenario, we want to know if Joe Biden will announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Resolution criteria: Joe Biden must make a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, stating that he will not accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, the question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this scenario, we want to know if Joe Biden will announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Resolution criteria: Joe Biden must make a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, stating that he will accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Will Hurd becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry considers the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, a decision made exclusively by the convention's delegates.

In this context, we aim to ascertain whether Joe Biden will publicly announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, his decision not to run for and not to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle of 2024.

Criteria for resolution: Joe Biden must issue a clear, public, and official statement that is unequivocal and definitive, indicating that he will not accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the specified deadline, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will Hurd will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden will not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Hurd will be the selected Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is confirmed as **Yes** if Hurd is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Joe Biden will make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President. This is confirmed as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
