para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Meta releases a report detailing findings from an independent red-team evaluation of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) the associated market achieves a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Meta issues a *publicly available* report containing the outcomes from an *outside* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) The market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

question.title: Will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Moldova not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Moldova does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Moldova set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Moldova takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other result, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Given Moldova qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Australia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Australia qualify for the Grand Final as well?

Resolution criteria:
- For Moldova: Resolves as **Yes** if Moldova qualifies for the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.
- For Australia: Resolves as **Yes** if Australia qualifies for the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.

not_P.title: Given Moldova does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Australia also not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Australia not qualify for the Grand Final as well?

Resolution criteria:
- For Moldova: Resolves as **Yes** if Moldova does not qualify for the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.
- For Australia: Resolves as **Yes** if Australia does not qualify for the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.

para_P.title: If Moldova secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Australia also make it through?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Moldova competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Australia also advance to the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For Moldova: Resolves as **Yes** if Moldova makes it to the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.
- For Australia: Resolves as **Yes** if Australia makes it to the Grand Final, otherwise **No**.

question.title: Will both Moldova and Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Moldova or Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Moldova or Australia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Moldova does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Australia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Moldova and Australia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both Moldova and Australia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Moldova takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Moldova or Australia fail to qualify, the question will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Czechia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Czechia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will San Marino also qualify?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, given Czechia's successful qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, San Marino also participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If San Marino does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**. If Czechia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Czechia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will San Marino not qualify?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, given Czechia's successful qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, San Marino also participates in a Semi-final but is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If San Marino qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**. If Czechia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Czechia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will San Marino secure a spot as well?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, following Czechia's successful entry into the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, San Marino also competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should San Marino fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**. In the event that Czechia does not qualify, this question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Will both Czechia and San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Czechia and San Marino participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or San Marino does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Czechia nor San Marino participate in their respective Semi-finals or are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or San Marino does qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Czechia and San Marino set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Czechia and San Marino take part in their individual Semi-finals and are formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or San Marino fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or is within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer will be given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

not_P.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators not work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

para_P.title: If Trump secures a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants against Biden compared to a generic Democrat, will a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators advocate for Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll inquires Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly suggested Biden should step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances for November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to withdraw from his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with these discussions.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of a letter similar to the ones mentioned above, or it could involve a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective communication. If five individuals separately express to reporters that they believe Biden should step down, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming the following holds: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more when both polls conclude. Then, will a coalition of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators collaborate to pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20th?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? (2) Will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? (2) Will a group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by less than 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (1) Will Trump receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat in his matchup against Joe Biden? (2) Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat. This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, then the answer is NO.

(2) This market will resolve as YES if a group consisting of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or through a group meeting with Biden to collectively ask him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Merely having five individuals separately express to reporters their belief that Biden should resign is inadequate for a YES outcome. Reports of any unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to resign will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, the market will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before the stroke of midnight on July 20 Eastern Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Mike Pence be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Mike Pence not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Mike Pence become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Will Mike Pence be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for determining P: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves to YES if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20 or (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20 and (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden either withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

not_P.title: Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?

This market will determine a YES outcome if Elon Musk appears as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is among the biggest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

not_P.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump not be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

para_P.title: If Elon Musk is present at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to YES if Elon Musk appears on the official stage at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the major Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

Assuming the following is accurate: Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Will Donald Trump then be officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Criteria for Trump's removal: The removal or disqualification must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution. The question will resolve as "Yes" if these criteria are met by July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk appears on stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk appears on stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (b) Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Elon Musk takes the stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the official platform of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution. The question specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority Representation from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Fidesz-KDNP maintains its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections, meaning they secure more seats than any other single party or coalition according to credible sources. Given that this condition is met, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports.

not_P.title: Conditional on Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will the EU not announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Fidesz-KDNP maintains its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections, meaning they secure more seats than any other single party or coalition according to credible sources. Given that this condition is met, will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the EU has not announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports.

para_P.title: Assuming Fidesz-KDNP retains its majority of seats from Hungary in the EU in 2024, will the EU implement new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: Let’s consider this scenario: Fidesz-KDNP keeps its majority of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament after the 2024 elections, meaning they have more seats than any other individual party or coalition according to reliable sources. If this condition holds, will the European Union put forth new tariffs or charges on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the EU has announced new tariffs or charges on Chinese electric vehicle imports before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP does not maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources do not report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Fidesz-KDNP continues to hold the majority of Hungary's seats in the EU in 2024 (b) The EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian representation in the European Parliament, as confirmed by reliable sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, trustworthy sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has disclosed the implementation of new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Denmark also qualify?
question.body: Suppose Poland qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Then, will Denmark qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? Denmark needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Denmark does not qualify, it resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Denmark not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose Poland qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Then, will Denmark not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? Denmark needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Denmark qualifies, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Poland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Denmark also make it through?
para_P.body: Assuming Poland secures a position in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, which entails Poland competing in a Semi-final and being officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final. In that case, will Denmark also make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? For Denmark to be considered qualified, it must participate in a Semi-final and be officially acknowledged by the EBU as having made it to the Grand Final, resulting in a Yes answer. If Denmark fails to qualify, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will both Poland and Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Poland or Denmark not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Poland and Denmark qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both Poland and Denmark make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Denmark competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. The value is reported as positive for a Trump lead and negative for a Biden lead, and this is verified on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or is greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or is greater than 3 according to 538's national polling average. The value is reported as positive for a Trump lead and negative for a Biden lead, and this is verified on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

para_P.title: If Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple's on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 based on 538's national polling average. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative one indicates a Biden lead, and this is confirmed on July 17, 2024.

Is it then accurate to say that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the lead should be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

(b) Nvidia's market capitalization will be compared to Apple's on June 28, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). The question resolves **Yes** if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on that date.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the lead should not be greater than 2 or not be less than or equal to 3 points.

(b) Nvidia's market capitalization will not be compared to Apple's on June 28, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). The question resolves **Yes** if Nvidia's market cap is not greater than Apple's on that date.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be assessed using 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, and this lead must be more than 2 and at most 3 points.

(b) Nvidia's market value will be evaluated against Apple's on June 28, 2024, based on Companies Market Cap, when reviewed by Metaculus at around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). The question will resolve **Yes** if Nvidia's market value is greater than that of Apple on that date.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group achieves the highest seat count after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and it will be **No** for any other results. If two groups end up with an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: If Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: If Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Should the Greens–EFA be the leading party following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This results in a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction indeed has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and a **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will yield a **Yes**. The resolution of this question will rely on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

Consequently, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024? The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without requiring a VPN (potentially involving a fee). If it is not available in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest seat count following the 2024 European Parliament elections, otherwise it will be marked as **No**. In the event of a tie between two groups for seat count, both components of the question will be marked as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

(b) The question will be marked as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. The term "broadly accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is to have access without needing a VPN (which may involve a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if access is restricted to specific groups (like minors), it will still be marked positively, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be marked positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

not_P.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75%? (not "Certified Fresh")
not_P.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, given "Twisters" (2024) is "Certified Fresh"?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release, as displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. This score is used to determine if the movie is "Certified Fresh" for the purposes of this question.

Given this condition, will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391? This resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391. If "Twisters" does not achieve a score of at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, the condition is not met and this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes score of at least 75% one week after release AND will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of 75% or higher one week after its release on July 26th, as displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. The score is based on the integer percentage listed by Rotten Tomatoes. 
(b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), as reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

para_P.title: Will the film "Twisters" (2024) achieve a Rotten Tomatoes rating of at least 75% one week post-release AND will "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" together?
