question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Is Disney set to reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will conclude with a YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will result in a NO if it is mentioned in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will also result in a NO if a Moana attraction is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention. The resolution will occur after the convention.

question.title: Conditional on Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two independent events: Disney's announcement of a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office performance of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

Criterion for the condition: Resolves YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is only discussed as an idea or if announced for a different park.

Criterion for the outcome: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend and is reported as the record for an R-rated movie release by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Disney not announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two independent events: Disney's not announcing a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office performance of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

Criterion for the condition: Resolves YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, or if it is only discussed as an idea or announced for a different park. It resolves NO if the ride is announced for the Magic Kingdom.

Criterion for the outcome: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" does not gross more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend or is not reported as the record for an R-rated movie release by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Disney reveals a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024, will the opening weekend for Deadpool & Wolverine be the highest ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible relationship between two independent occurrences: Disney's revelation of a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office success of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.

Condition criterion: Resolves YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is merely proposed as a concept or if announced for a different park.

Outcome criterion: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5M globally during its opening weekend and is reported as the highest record for an R-rated film release by the Hollywood Reporter or a similar publication. Resolves NO in all other cases.

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations between $340 million and $360 million globally. Domestically, it is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve YES if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve YES if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie does not gross more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Analysts are not projecting a huge opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations between $340 million and $360 million globally. Domestically, it is not expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it not the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Disney will unveil a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will conclude with a NO if it is mentioned in a conceptual discussion similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will also conclude with a NO if a Moana attraction is announced for a different theme park in Florida or anywhere else. Betting will end on August 8, the day preceding the convention. The resolution will occur after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend as per reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Analysts predict a significant opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations ranging from $340 million to $360 million globally. Domestically, it is anticipated to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the largest R-rated opening of all time. The current record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Belgium not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Belgium set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, the response will be **No**.

question.title: If Belgium qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body:
This question examines the qualification of Czechia for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Belgium has already qualified. 

Resolution criteria for Belgium (Condition): Belgium must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Czechia (Outcome): Czechia must participate in a Semi-final and then be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Belgium does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: If Belgium qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia not qualify?
not_P.body:
This question examines the qualification of Czechia for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Belgium has already qualified. 

Resolution criteria for Belgium (Condition): Belgium must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Czechia (Outcome): Czechia must participate in a Semi-final and then be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Belgium does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should Belgium make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also make the cut?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates whether Czechia will secure a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, contingent upon Belgium's successful qualification. 

Criteria for Belgium's qualification (Condition): Belgium needs to compete in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024.

Criteria for Czechia's qualification (Outcome): Czechia must also take part in a Semi-final and subsequently be officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024.

In the event that Belgium fails to qualify, this question is considered N/A.

question.title: Will both Belgium and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Belgium and Czechia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Belgium or Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Belgium or Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Belgium or Czechia does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Belgium and Czechia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Belgium and Czechia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Belgium and Czechia take part in their individual Semi-finals and are formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Belgium or Czechia fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Czechia does not advance, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Czechia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Azerbaijan also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Azerbaijan also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final as described.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

Suppose the following is true: Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Azerbaijan not qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final as described.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Azerbaijan does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan qualifies, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Czechia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Azerbaijan also make it?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Azerbaijan also make it to the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final as stated.
- The outcome is resolved as **Yes** if Azerbaijan competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the outcome is resolved as **No**.
- If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both Czechia and Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Czechia and Azerbaijan participate in their respective Semi-finals and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan participate in their respective Semi-finals or if they do participate but are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Czechia and Azerbaijan both set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both Czechia and Azerbaijan take part in their respective Semi-finals and are subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if either Czechia or Azerbaijan fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure reported for that date is Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, credible reports will indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, to be considered.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, there will be no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, to be considered.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will there be a lethal assault by Israel inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by a margin greater than 2 and not more than 3, as per 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election. This information is verified by reviewing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure reflects a Trump lead.

Under these conditions, can we expect that before May 1, 2024, reliable sources will report that an attack linked to Israel, taking place within Iran, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people? The incident must happen after this question is published and before May 1, 2024, to qualify.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (2) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Israel will execute a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage.

2. After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack linked to Israel and taking place within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024, must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on the St. Louis Fed's reporting at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Israel must carry out a deadly attack within Iran's borders resulting in the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports, between the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions are met, **No** if the first condition is met but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first condition is not met.

not_P.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on the St. Louis Fed's reporting at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Israel must not carry out a deadly attack within Iran's borders resulting in the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports, between the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions are met, **No** if the first condition is met but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first condition is not met.

para_P.title: If the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry consists of two criteria:

1. **Criterion**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) needs to be greater on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023. This will be confirmed through the St. Louis Fed's data available at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Desired Outcome**: Israel must conduct a lethal operation within the territory of Iran resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people, as reported by reliable sources, between the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024.

The answer will be **Yes** if both criteria are fulfilled, **No** if the first criterion is satisfied but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first criterion is not fulfilled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's report: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Credible reports must indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 nor (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must not be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's report: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) No credible reports must indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) On July 20, 2024, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will exceed its value from July 20, 2023? (b) Israel will execute a lethal assault within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) On July 20, 2024, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be recorded at a level greater than it was on July 20, 2023, based on the St. Louis Fed's findings: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Reliable sources must confirm that, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, an attack linked to Israel that occurs within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Republican National Convention chooses Tucker Carlson as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate's selection will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the running; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) decide to nominate.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No** for this condition. This selection is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No** for this condition. This selection is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Tucker Carlson is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This implies that if any other candidate is chosen, the outcome will be **No** for this condition. The nominee is determined exclusively by the selections made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Now, can we say that the Republican Party will maintain Ohio's 6th congressional district (which was previously held by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024? This inquiry will be answered with Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting information from popular sources, a statement from an Ohio State source will be considered. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to take place: (a) Tucker Carlson being chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party holding onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the following two conditions are satisfied: (1) Tucker Carlson is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (which was previously occupied by Bill Johnson). In cases where popular sources conflict, an official statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, the inquiry is rendered void.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

not_P.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden not still be president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

para_P.title: If Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden remain president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Nikki Haley is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made by the delegates of the convention, rather than by who is nominated on the day of the election in 2024.

Under these circumstances, can we say that Joe Biden will still hold the office of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

If both conditions are met, the question resolves to **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves to **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

If neither condition is met, the question resolves to **Yes**. If either or both conditions are met, the question resolves to **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024.

2. Joe Biden continues to hold the office of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Should both criteria be satisfied, the resolution to the question will be **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not satisfied, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

Then, is it true that Ron DeSantis will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention. It will resolve as **No** for all other candidates. The question is not restricted to currently listed candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024, will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

Then, is it true that Ron DeSantis will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention. It will resolve as **No** for all other candidates. The question is not restricted to currently listed candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden stays in office until the end of July 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: Biden continues to serve as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This implies that he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that date. It is important to note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not change this condition, as an Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

Given this, is it correct to say that Ron DeSantis will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will be answered with **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention. It will be answered with **No** for any other candidates. The question is not limited to those currently listed; additional candidates may emerge in the future. The outcome is determined solely by the selection made at the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024 or (b) Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden continues to serve as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President as defined by the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews integrated into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it also true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This is determined by the reported value on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

This excludes press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but may include guest appearances on podcasts, late-night television shows, or interviews that are part of a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person.

Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will exceed 3 points and be at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview can be on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but must include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

not_P.body:

This includes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview cannot be on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, and must not include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must not be greater than 3 and must not be less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before July 31, 2024, and will Donald Trump have a lead over Biden of more than 3 points but not exceeding 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to engage in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview may occur on a podcast, late night television show, or a program like 60 Minutes, but it must feature at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 points and less than or equal to 4 points, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump. This value will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will an athlete not win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". If confirmed before the end of the Games that they have won 21 or more gold medals, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals?
not_P.body:

Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". If confirmed before the end of the Games that they have won fewer than 21 gold medals, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds true: An athlete secures multiple medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This implies that any athlete earns a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it accurate to say that Individual Neutral Athletes will together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The outcome will be determined as "Yes" if the Individual Neutral Athletes collectively earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. If it is confirmed before the conclusion of the Games that they have won 21 or more gold medals, it will immediately be resolved as "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) At least one athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition is considered met immediately.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) At least one athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition is considered not met immediately.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) A tennis player secures more than one medal (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

(a) At least one tennis player earns two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes together win 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count reported by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have reached 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this criterion will be regarded as satisfied immediately.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.body:

In this context, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, the question asks whether Kamala Harris will be nominated as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is nominated, the answer is YES. If someone else is selected as VP, the answer is NO. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed after the nomination.

question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? 

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

2. Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

This combined question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This query is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is indeed the nominee, as determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model? Specifically, the question resolves **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves **No** otherwise.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Given Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
