Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase according to Nate Silver's model? Specifically, the question resolves **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves **No** otherwise.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: If Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's chances of winning improve in the coming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assuming Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is confirmed as the candidate by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this context, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory increase based on Nate Silver's analysis? Specifically, the inquiry resolves **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves **No** if that is not the case.

Link to analysis: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM.

If either condition is satisfied, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Kamala's chances of victory will rise over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of these criteria are fulfilled: 

1. Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM.

Both criteria must be met for this inquiry to conclude as **Yes**. If either criterion is not satisfied, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Given Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal not qualify as well?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Switzerland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal also secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming that Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Portugal also compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Switzerland and Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Switzerland and Portugal participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland or Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Switzerland nor Portugal participate in their respective Semi-finals or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland or Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Switzerland and Portugal both set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both Switzerland and Portugal take part in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland or Portugal fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition that is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of a political alliance that is neither New Popular Front nor Together?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if, at 12:00 Central European Time on July 30th, the Prime Minister of France's party is not affiliated with New Popular Front or Together, based on reliable information.

question.title: Conditional on the Prime Minister of France not belonging to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This will be determined if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Prime Minister of France belonging to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition that is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This will be determined if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Assuming the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with either New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024. This will be confirmed if the Prime Minister's party is identified as not being New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

In that case, will the ID political group have the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? The answer will be **Yes** if the ID political group indeed holds the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be **No** for all other political parties. If there is a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both related questions will be marked as **Yes**.

This inquiry will be resolved according to [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media coverage.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This component resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
(b) This component resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will NOT BOTH of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) This component resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
(b) This component resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will happen: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, and (b) the ID political faction will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.
(b) This part will be considered Yes if the ID political faction obtains the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. All other political factions will be considered No. If two factions are equal in the number of seats, both components will be considered Yes. This will be determined based on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Ted Cruz is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed based on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed based on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Should Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated on the election day.

Then, can we affirm that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be evaluated using the data for July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the value reported for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. **Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the value reported for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both conditions will happen: (1) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's margin over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. **Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This decision is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is declared the Republican nominee on the election day of 2024.

2. **Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 2 and is at most 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is determined by the figure reported for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Conditional on Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question combines two forecasting scenarios:

1. **Condition**: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Resolution: If Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, then the question resolves YES if Joe Biden makes such an announcement before the deadline, and NO if he does not. If Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee, the question resolves N/A.

Resolution: If Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, then the question resolves YES if Joe Biden does not make such an announcement before the deadline, and NO if he does.

This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The outcome is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 election cycle. If such a declaration is not made before the deadline, this inquiry will be answered with No.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will result in a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, given this condition, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The question resolves **Yes** if such charges or indictments occur before the specified date.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Donald Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, given this condition, will Donald Trump be not charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The question resolves **Yes** if such charges or indictments do not occur before the specified date.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as determined by verified information from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Then, under this condition, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The inquiry will be resolved with a **Yes** if such charges or indictments take place before the indicated date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) This condition resolves to "Yes" if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must not occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following situations happen: (a) Kamala Harris serves as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be considered "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports.

(b) This condition will be viewed as "Yes" if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks involving potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign from his current presidential term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, though he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated office by that time. A statement of his intent to resign is adequate for this market to resolve positively.

Conversely, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and not run for re-election. The actual resignation does not have to occur by the end of July, just the announcement.

Given this, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be at least 145 yen per USD at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance?

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July, will USD be worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and not run for re-election. The actual resignation does not have to occur by the end of July, just the announcement.

Given this, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be less than 145 yen per USD at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance?

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from office prior to the conclusion of July, will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY by the end of trading on August 9, 2024?
para_P.body:
Imagine that it is confirmed: Joe Biden states that he will not seek re-election and will resign from the presidency before July 31, 2024, in Pacific Time. This indicates that he intends to end his current term and not pursue another term. The actual resignation is not required to happen by the end of July, only the announcement itself.

In light of this, will the exchange rate of USD to JPY be at least 145 yen for every USD at the close of the market on August 9, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency, and (b) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if USD/JPY close is listed as >= 145 on August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency, or (b) USD is worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if USD/JPY close is listed as < 145 on August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to the conclusion of July 2024 that he is both stepping down and resigning from the presidency, and (b) the USD will be valued at >= 145 JPY at the closing on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden states that he is withdrawing from the race for re-election and that he will be resigning, thereby not finishing his current term. Such declarations must be made before July 2024 ends in Pacific Time; however, he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position before the end of July. A declaration of his plan to do so is enough to resolve this market positively.

Otherwise, this part will be marked as NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the USD/JPY closing rate is listed as >= 145 on August 9th, 2024 according to Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) not advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla shareholders vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If ISS advises against Musk's package or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the above condition is true. Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: If ISS does not advise against Musk's package and re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for 2024?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the above condition is true. Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Should ISS recommend against Musk's compensation or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for 2024?
para_P.body:
The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

Assuming the aforementioned condition holds true, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will result in a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future. For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will NEITHER of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk, NOR (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if ISS does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will happen: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be considered **Yes** if ISS issues a statement clearly suggesting that Tesla shareholders should vote *against* either Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, it will be **No**.

(2) The second condition will be deemed **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has not been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge experience an assault prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

not_P.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

para_P.title: If the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body: Assume the following scenario is accurate: Between May 2, 2024, and June 30, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the bridge's structural integrity. Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) An attack on the Crimean Bridge occurs prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reputable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by weaponry, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if no such warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the ICC release arrest warrants for any Israeli officials listed before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This happens if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Then, is it accurate to say that prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? The outcome is Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No if it is not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for none of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden is declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) the ICC issues arrest warrants for any Israeli officials listed before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or an equivalent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency through death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will resolve as **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution for this question is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of not accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution for this question is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie become the Republican nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
Imagine this scenario: Joe Biden issues a clear, public, and official statement prior to July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This statement must be unequivocal and final, eliminating any chance of him accepting the nomination.

In that case, can we conclude that Chris Christie will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer to this question hinges entirely on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select as their nominee, rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(2) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (2) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(2) Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) Chris Christie becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) Is Joe Biden going to declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

(2) Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpass $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Conditional on "Deadpool & Wolverine" having a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This is verified by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (season finale) will have an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, two days after its release? The resolution is based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after release, at noon PT. The score must be a strict inequality (>8.5) and will use the precision listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal.

not_P.title: Conditional on "Deadpool & Wolverine" having a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated ≤8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This is verified by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (season finale) will have an IMDB rating less than or equal to 8.5, two days after its release? The resolution is based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after release, at noon PT. The score must be a non-strict inequality (≤8.5) and will use the precision listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal.

para_P.title: Given that "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpasses the combined domestic box office opening of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will the IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" S2E8 exceed 8.5 two days post-release?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This is confirmed by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

Then, can we assert that the IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 8 (the season finale) will be greater than 8.5 two days after it is released? The determination is based on the rating shown on IMDB two days after the release, at noon PT. The rating must be strictly greater than 8.5 and will adhere to the precision indicated by IMDB, typically to one decimal place.
