question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office by that time. A declaration of his plan to resign will suffice to settle this market.

If no such announcement is made, this market will be resolved as NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be YES.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump not be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be YES.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his exit from the presidential race and his resignation prior to the conclusion of July, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia ahead of June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Assume the following situation: Joe Biden makes a public statement that he is withdrawing from the race for re-election and intends to resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This indicates his decision to not fulfill his current term and to exit the electoral contest. It is important to note that he does not need to have officially resigned by the end of July, only to have declared his intention to do so. In light of this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in connection with potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? For the answer to be YES, the indictment must happen before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares his intention to withdraw and resign prior to the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This part resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he will not seek re-election and that he intends to resign from his current position, with these declarations made before the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his office by the end of July; a declaration of his intention to resign is adequate for this component to be resolved positively.

(b) This part resolves to YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with these charges being filed before June 1, 2024.

The overall question will resolve to YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If this does not occur, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Iceland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also make it?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland make it to the Grand Final? This question will be answered with **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Iceland or Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Iceland or Ireland does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Iceland and Ireland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland take part in their respective Semi-finals and are officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.body:

The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this event will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Then, in this scenario, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? This resolves YES if such a letter is signed by at least 20 lawmakers before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also count. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will fewer than 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this event will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Then, in this scenario, will fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? This resolves YES if such a letter is not signed by at least 20 lawmakers before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 signatures also count. If these criteria are met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday, will 20 Democrats stand against the early nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for confirming this event will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

In this case, will at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators publicly sign a letter opposing the initiative to nominate President Joe Biden ahead of schedule? This will be marked as YES if such a letter is endorsed by a minimum of 20 lawmakers before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that together have at least 20 signatures will also be counted. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will both Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden by July 21, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (2) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024. Otherwise, this question resolves to "No".

not_P.title: Will either Kamala Harris not become President by July 26, 2024, or fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats not sign a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden by July 21, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (2) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024. Otherwise, this question resolves to "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the role of President by July 26, 2024, while also having a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly sign a letter against the premature nomination of Biden by July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources; (2) A public letter against the early nomination of President Joe Biden is endorsed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators by the conclusion of Sunday, July 21, 2024. If these conditions are not met, the question will resolve to "No".

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, yet all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios either lead or fall within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is determined if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected as the nominee for this question to resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

not_P.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

para_P.title: If Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate, will Biden be officially deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible political implications if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The condition for this scenario is that Nikki Haley must be appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate.

In this context, we seek to determine whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) will activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare President Biden unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office, thus allowing the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question to be answered with a YES.

It is important to clarify that Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or the activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply to this question. The discussion focuses on the potential activation of the 25th Amendment as proposed by a GOP lawmaker.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Nikki Haley becoming the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permit the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the office of the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. Nevertheless, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump face removal or obstruction from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion that lasts for more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This can include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night television, or segments edited into shows like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed directly. However, this does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings.

In that case, will it be accurate to say that Donald Trump will be removed or prevented from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (such as President, Senate, or House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be determined as "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as validated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. It will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, nor (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must not be released before the end of July 2024. Non-qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with less than 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must not be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will suffice. The resolution accounts for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following events to happen: (1) Joe Biden to conduct an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in an in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, not counting press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be made public before the end of July 2024. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. 

(2) Donald Trump must be formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate. The outcome does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or reversals following July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Criteria for the outcome: It resolves to “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves to “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, given that by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, Anthropic also publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date. para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta issues a *public* report containing the outcomes from an *external* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, and Anthropic similarly releases a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by that same date. If Meta fails to publish such a report by the specified date, this question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Will both Meta and Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, and (b) Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will both Meta and Anthropic release public reports detailing findings from independent red-teaming assessments of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met by June 30, 2024: (a) Meta issues a *public* report presenting the findings from an *external* entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models, and (b) Anthropic issues a *public* report presenting the findings from an *external* entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 in the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference in polling numbers between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump leads Biden by more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: A positive value in the polling average indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The specific range for this question is a Trump lead greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

Then, is the following true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for this outcome: This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other outcomes resolve as NO, regardless of who receives the nomination on election day.

not_P.title: Given Trump leads Biden by more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: A positive value in the polling average indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The specific range for this question is a Trump lead greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

Then, is the following true: Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for this outcome: This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other outcomes resolve as NO, regardless of who receives the nomination on election day.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 points but not exceeding 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 points and less than or equal to 3 points, as per the report from Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Criteria for resolving this condition: A positive polling average signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative average indicates a lead for Biden. The specific condition for this inquiry is a Trump lead that is more than 2 points but not exceeding 3 points.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Asa Hutchinson has been nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Criteria for resolving this outcome: This will be considered YES if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee. Any other results will be resolved as NO, regardless of who is ultimately nominated on election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question will resolve as **No** if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the context of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry. (b) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently under consideration; other possibilities may emerge in the future. For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Czechia does not advance, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Armenia qualify as well?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Czechia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and asks whether Armenia will also qualify.

Resolution criteria for P: The condition is met if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Q: The outcome will be resolved as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the outcome will resolve as **No**.

If Czechia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Armenia not qualify as well?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Czechia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and asks whether Armenia will not qualify.

Resolution criteria for P: The condition is met if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Q: The outcome will be resolved as **Yes** if Armenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia qualifies, the outcome will resolve as **No**.

If Czechia does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Czechia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Armenia also make it through?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which Czechia secures a position in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, and questions whether Armenia will also succeed in qualifying.

Resolution criteria for P: The condition is fulfilled if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Q: The outcome will be determined as **Yes** if Armenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia fails to qualify, the outcome will be determined as **No**.

If Czechia does not qualify, the question is resolved as N/A.

question.title: Will both Czechia and Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Czechia and Armenia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Czechia or Armenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Czechia or Armenia does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Czechia and Armenia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Czechia and Armenia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Czechia and Armenia take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should either Czechia or Armenia fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Is Iceland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Georgia qualifies under these conditions, and **No** otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final as well?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. para_P.title: If Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also secure a spot in the Grand Final?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will Georgia also compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? The answer will be **Yes** if Georgia qualifies under these circumstances, and **No** if it does not.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both countries do not meet these conditions, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Iceland nor Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both countries meet these conditions, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Iceland and Georgia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent requirements are fulfilled: (1) Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both nations fail to satisfy these criteria, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.
